title: Tuturtinular
author: Tuturtinular
content: Gambling is a place to spend money, although many gamblers consider casinos to be a place to earn money. But in reality, more gamblers lose their money at casinos or gambling sites. So I think all of us here probably have almost the same experience, namely losing a lot of money gamblingI also lost money because I lost on gambling, but maybe not that much. But I know there are people who spend a lot of money for gambling. In your opinion, what should we do if we have lost a lot of money on gambling? Do we keep gambling to win so we can cover up previous losses? or stop and work normally and leave gambling? Or do you have other suggestions?

Or do you have other suggestions?The gambling is the game which give us some entertainment,but we should use the free money to get the fun from the gambling.The gambling doesn’t provide you the loss,sometimes the gambling sites will give you enough money for the future by the big win.The big win was the asset of the gamblers,with my gambling experience.I had come across hundreds of gambler,from that only the people who was in longer period was earning good money from the gambling.The big win favour the old traders all the time,So do active participation in the gambling to get big win one day.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: Your mistake is use a lot money to gamble, if you're not use a lot money, you will not feel miserable when you lose your money.What you need to do? recovering all of your previous losses isn't the option because gambling isn't for making money, but you can do to limit your money for gambling. You can start as low as you can and then increase the amount until you feel fine to lose it.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Quote from: Tuturtinular on October 09, 2023, 02:09:57 PM...what should we do if we have lost a lot of money on gambling?Do we keep gambling to win so we can cover up previous losses? or stop and work normally and leave gambling? Or do you have other suggestions?The term "a lot of money" is subjective to one's financial status so only you know how much is a lot of money for you.I don't gamble to win (chase back) the lost money from a previous bet and again it depends on individuals but what is the right thing to do to avoid chasing the loss cause it leads to further loss that can be avoided if we just stopped at the right time.If you ever feel that you are betting a lot of money then its a sign of addiction towards gambling so as soon as you notice it then better take a break from gambling if you still can't control the urge then its time to see a therapist.

comments.author: MArsland
comments.body: Quote from: Tuturtinular on October 09, 2023, 02:09:57 PMI also lost money because I lost on gambling, but maybe not that much. But I know there are people who spend a lot of money for gambling. In your opinion, what should we do if we have lost a lot of money on gambling? Do we keep gambling to win so we can cover up previous losses? or stop and work normally and leave gambling? Or do you have other suggestions?The first mistake is chasing losses, it will only make you lose more and will not achieve the goal of returning what was lost. Because in gambling, generally when you lose, it means you give up all the money you have left to spend. It seems like you are the type of gambler who can't control your winnings, you are always ambitious even though you have doubled your profits. Not having management is already the second mistake.So the solution is not to stop suddenly, because I'm sure that won't work at all. Start planning to reduce your spending on gambling. Then during times of the week that are usually active 7x, maybe try forcing yourself to play 3x a week. This takes too long, but if accompanied by the determination to stop, I think there's no harm in trying. This is not good advice, but at least you should know how important financial management is in gambling.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: You should stop, and probably get some help. If you lost a lot of money gambling, that just means that you are in too deep and might require help from people that will intervene with your activities. You'll never get to get your money back from gambling 100%, but you can get it through other means like working for a job or selling stuff that other people might find useful. I don't really get it why gamblers still want to justify their activities to other people, when in fact what's happening is that they're just digging a deeper hole for themselves if they continued gambling after a massive loss thinking they can get back the initial money they have put in.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: That's why it is usually advisable to only gamble money you can afford to lose. In gambling, you make some profits which isn't guaranteed, but sure thing is that you will have loses. If you had lost to gamble, there's nothing you can do, but to decide for your self, if you want to continue playing or you want to quit at that point. Gambling is for fun so you don't really have to leave it for good just because you had lost a couple of games. You may take some time to chill out and later come back if you so which but now you play with a new strategy. You learn from your previous loss and create a new playing style.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: Since you don't have much. You better stop and just consider a sure win like getting a job and maybe a second job.You won't miss anything in gambling or in the casino since you are not hooked into it yet I presume since you ask this question. The best you can do is just focus on where you are good at because that's what normal people do and quit gambling while you haven't lost thousands yet.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: Tuturtinular on October 09, 2023, 02:09:57 PMIn your opinion, what should we do if we have lost a lot of money on gambling? Do we keep gambling to win so we can cover up previous losses? or stop and work normally and leave gambling? Or do you have other suggestions?Thinking of winning back a lost money in gambling is a way you would have more emotion that will let you to be losing more and more money until you will realize that it will not be possible. Do not go beyond your gambling budget, bet little amount of money if you want to continue to gamble for a long time. Do not gamble to make money.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: You can do lots of other things. Gambling probably isn’t the only thing that gives you pleasure. What about reading a book or watching a movie? How about going outside and getting some fresh air? There are many other options which you can choose from. Don’t get obsessed with gambling too much or else you might damage your mental health. You are not the first guy who lost money to gambling. If you lost, you lost. Now it is time to take a break and so something else. If you keep insisting on playing, you will probably lose more money.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Having the mentality of making money from gambling will only make you lose more money and only make you look as if you want to become a Ponzi scheme chaser,  this is because in the end you have a wrong motive and that can never give you good results and if you must take gambling for anything is shouldn't be more than just fun. A lot of folks in my neighbourhood have become poor due to the same wrong mentality of taking gambling for money-making reasons,  the fact is that there is no way the gambler will have an advantage over the house other than paying the casino for the game's entertainment.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: If you just love the casino games then it would be better to take it slow. How? By betting low amounts and then just aiming for a jackpot prize. I have done that recently and I enjoy gambling more than what I did before which is betting at medium risk with the prize ain't that big. But, if you cannot control it anymore then it's better to just stay away from it. Like you said, we will just keep on losing in this industry and the winning part is very slim unless we can control our emotions and get out whenever we have a little profit. Gambling ain't for the weak heart, it will just be the start of stress and worse suicide if it cannot be controlled. A stressful environment can be the start of many types of sickness and you don't want to be in that position. When you keep on losing and you are not getting over them then it's time to stop.

comments.author: mirakal
comments.body: If you consistently lose a lot from gambling without giving you some profits at some point, maybe that could be a sign to leave gambling for good. Gambling is not designed for us to lose a lot, but for us to get entertained and enjoy the games. However, if you only lose that certain day because luck does not favor you, just call it a day and leave the casino. There’s no point in staying and continue gambling if luck is not on your side. Just try to gamble again when the vibes is good and you think you’ll make your day profitable through gambling.

Or do you have other suggestions?Chasing our losses is not good and should be avoided at all costs because we cannot recover our losses, gambling is a game of luck you could lose ten sessions in a row and the gambling community keeps preaching to minimize your losses and your session.You don't have to leave gambling you just need to moderate it and not take it seriously to the point that you will put your savings into it, so much wealth has been loss because there are people who cannot accept defeat in gambling these people are blinded on the fact that they cannot beat the house.When you lose in gambling, take hold of yourself and ask these questions? Are you comfortable with your loss, are you hurt, and promise to comeback,  be honest with yourself if your answer is the latter then you have a big problem and you need to consult to a professional, you could lose everything if you failed to ask for help.

For your wallet.If you are hopelessly ill a gambler who can't imagine life without gambling, then at least take a break for a while. Ideally, stop gambling. That's exactly what I did, after my last loss, without even trying to win back.
